title: Ron DeSantis is planning a campaign reboot as he struggles to close the gap with Trump
description: TALLAHASSEE — Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis’ campaign is planning a reboot, top campaign officials told NBC News, with a significant shift on messaging, events and media strategy.

title: The dark history of the courthouse in Jason Aldean’s new music video
description: Country singer Jason Aldean is facing backlash for featuring Maury County Courthouse, the site of a black teen’s lynching in 1927, in his music video.

title: Pioneering hacker Kevin Mitnick, felon turned security guru, dead at 59
description: Kevin Mitnick, whose pioneering antics tricking employees in the 1980s and 1990s into helping him steal software and services from big phone and tech companies made him the most celebrated U.S. hacker, has died at age 59.

title: Conservatives are changing K-12 education, and one Christian college is at the center
description: Hillsdale College, a small Christian school in Michigan, developed the 1776 Curriculum, a go-to resource for conservatives looking to overhaul K-12 education.

title: Chinese spy balloon exposed gaps in U.S. ability to detect threats, NORAD commander says
description: The suspected Chinese spy balloon that flew across North America earlier this year exposed important gaps in the United States’ ability to detect airborne threats, a senior U.S. commander told NBC News in an exclusive interview.

title: As temperatures spike, so do cases of second- and third-degree burns
description: As record temperatures linger across the U.S., some are experiencing serious medical effects such as second- or third-degree burns and heat-related illnesses.

title: A teachers union says it’s fed up with social media’s impact on students
description: The nation’s second-largest teachers union said Thursday it was losing patience with social media apps that it says are contributing to mental health problems and misbehavior in classrooms nationwide, draining time and money from teachers and school systems.

title: Tupac Shakur warrant was for house of gang member who says he witnessed murder
description: Nevada police served a search warrant Monday looking for laptops and other electronic devices at an alleged witness’ home who was in the suspect's car when superstar rapper Tupac Shakur was fatally shot in Las Vegas in 1996, according to the warrant exclusively obtained by NBC News on Thursday.

title: Google says AI tools meant to help journalists and not to replace them
description: Google said Thursday that it is exploring AI-enabled tools for news publishers.

title: Execution of James Barber, first Alabama inmate to be put to death after state's pause, can proceed
description: Alabama can proceed with its plan to put to death Barber on Thursday evening — its first execution since a pause on capital punishment prompted by a series of failed lethal injection attempts was lifted.

title: Blood-sicles and misters: Zookeepers look to keep animals cool in oppressive heat
description: Many of the Phoenix Zoo’s 3,000 animals are used to hot weather.

title: Florida family found guilty of selling bleach as fake Covid-19 cure through online church
description: Four members of a Florida family were convicted Wednesday of selling a toxic industrial bleach as a fake Covid-19 cure through their online church.

title: NYC subway using AI to track fare evasion
description: Surveillance software that uses artificial intelligence to spot people evading fares has been quietly rolled out to some of New York City’s subway stations and is poised to be introduced to more by the end of the year, according to public documents and government contracts obtained by NBC News.

title: Travis King spent 48 days in prison in South Korea before bolting across border to North
description: More details emerged Thursday about the last months in South Korea of a U.S. soldier who fled across the border to North Korea, as the isolated Communist country remained silent on his status.

title: Trump grand jury to hear testimony from aide who was with him on Jan. 6
description: A federal grand jury deciding whether to indict Donald Trump over his efforts to overturn the 2020 election will hear testimony from Trump aide William Russell.

title: Conservatives are making the Ohio abortion amendment about trans rights
description: Abortion opponents in Ohio are spending millions on attack ads taking aim at a proposed ballot measure that would enshrine abortion rights in the state constitution.

title: Sen. Casey rolls out bills to protect workers from AI surveillance and 'robot bosses'
description: Sen. Bob Casey will unveil two new bills Thursday that target artificial intelligence in the workplace.

title: To stop nail-biting, skin picking and hair pulling, new research suggests a simple technique
description: How do you stop biting your nails? An approach called habit replacement could help nail biters quit. It could also help with skin picking and trichotillomania.

title: House committee takes aim at U.S. venture capital firms for investments in Chinese A.I.
description: A House committee sent letters to four separate U.S. venture capital firms expressing “serious concern” about their investments in Chinese tech startups.

title: Gunman who 'ambushed' Fargo officers had 1,800 rounds of ammunition and a grenade, AG says
description: The gunman who ambushed Fargo police officers in Friday had an arsenal that included 1,800 rounds of ammunition and a homemade hand grenade, officials said.

title: Travis King was grieving the death of his young cousin before he crossed the border into North Korea, his family says
description: The 23-year-old Army private who intentionally crossed into North Korea on Tuesday had been grieving the loss of his young cousin, struggling with the distance from home and acting unlike himself when he was previously arrested in South Korea, where he was stationed, his family said Wednesday.
